#summary What is needed to develop jDental?

= Environment =

 * Eclipse Galileo 3.5 http://www.eclipse.org/downloads
 * Eclipse Subversive - SVN Team Provider 
  * Look at Help > Install New Software... > select Galileo - [http://download.eclipse.org/releases/galileo] > Collaboration Tools
 * Eclipse WASCE 2.1 plugin [http://download.boulder.ibm.com/ibmdl/pub/software/websphere/wasce/updates/]
 * We recommend to use one of these options:
   * wasce_ibm60sdk_setup-2.1.1.4-ia32linux.tar.bz2
   * wasce_ibm60sdk_setup-2.1.1.4-x86_64linux.tar.bz2

= Workstation Setup: Database =

  * Install PostgreSQL 8.3 (apt-get install postgresql-8.3)
  * Create database, structure tables and import basic data:
{{{
  $ adduser jdental
  $ su postgres
  $ createuser -s jdental
  $ psql
  postgres=# ALTER USER jdental WITH PASSWORD 'mypasswd';
  postgres=# \q
  $ su jdental
  $ createdb jdental
  $ psql jdental
  postgres=# \q
  $ su jdental
  $ psql -f /opt/jdental/jdental_structure.sql
  $ psql -f /opt/jdental/jdental_basic_data.sql
}}}
 * Install PGAdmin 3 (apt-get install pgadmin-3)

= Workstation Setup: Websphere Application Server Community Edition (WASCE) =

  * Download and install WASCE [http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/downloads/ws/wasce/]
  * Go to [http://jdbc.postgresql.org/download.html] and get JDBC type 4 .jar driver
  * Save the downloaded jar archive (postgresql-8.3-604.jdbc4.jar) to _/opt/IBM/WebSphere/AppServerCommunityEdition/lib_ and to _workspace/jdentalweb/WebContent/WEB-INF/lib/_
